parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Render Time Scope </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Search for selection in the object model (first in the memory level, then in geometry LODs).<br>
Returns position in model space. In <template><title>Name</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>short</value></part></template> it returns the initial position of the selection, in <template><title>arma2</title></template>/<template><title>arma3</title></template> position of the selection (e.g. when it is animated) in render time scope. If a selection does not exist [0,0,0] is returned. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''selectionPosition''' selectionName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> selectionName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - in format [[PositionRelative]] ([x,y,z] relative position in model space) </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> object '''selectionPosition''' [selectionName, LODName] <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.49.131660</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [selectionName, LODName]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> selectionName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> LODName: [[String]] - LOD name, one of the following:
* "Memory"
* "Geometry"
* "FireGeometry"
* "LandContact"
* "HitPoints" </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER24</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] - [x,y,z] relative position in model space </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "head_hit";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "pelvis";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "head";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> <code>_inModelPosition = [[player]] [[selectionPosition]] "camera";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE4</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[modelToWorld]], [[selectionNames]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on January 5, 2007 - 12:24
<dt class="note">[[User:Giova|Giova]]<dd class="note">
To know more selections simply create an eventHandler damage on an object.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>
[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 2|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands Arma 3|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands Take On Helicopters|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 29, 2015 - 09:35 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Jezuro|Jezuro]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Since 1.49.131660, you can use an alternative syntax:
<br><br>
object '''selectionPosition''' [selectionName, lodName]
<br><br>
lodName: "Memory", "Geometry", "FireGeometry", "LandContact", "HitPoints"
<br><br>
If the given selectionName is not found in the given lod, [0,0,0] is returned.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 25, 2017 - 15:13 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Do use the filter that comes with Alt Syntax to suit your needs. For example [[player]] has 3 selections called "head" and their [[selectionPosition]]s are quite different from each other:
<code>[[player]] [[selectionPosition]] ["head", "Memory"]; // [0.173798,0.330415,1.37783]
[[player]] [[selectionPosition]] ["head", "FireGeometry"]; // [0.14375,0.206039,1.44689]
[[player]] [[selectionPosition]] ["head", "HitPoints"]; // [0.144257,0.306769,1.53471]</code></dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
